subsection.name: Blocks and templates
subsection.p: Any web application can be used as a provider. The master application will be able to use blocks and templates delimited with special HTML comments.

subsection.name: Cross technologies
subsection.p: As we only use HTML comments inside provider applications, a provider application may have been developed with any technology, including Java, PHP on .NET.

subsection.name: Reverse proxy
subsection.p: The kit contains a reverse-proxy servlet that can be used to retrieve static contents from the provider applications (images, css, js...). For better performance, you may prefer to use Apache mod_proxy powerfull module but the reverse-proxy servlet may as well be used in a production environment with good performance.

subsection.name: Aggregator
subsection.p: The aggregator is a reverse-proxy servlet that can parse the pages on the fly and process inclusion instructions inserted in the pages by the applications as tags.

subsection.name: ESI 1.0 specification support
subsection.p: In addition to its native syntax using HTML comments, the Website Assembling Toolkit partially supports ESI specification (for now, only esi:include and esi comments are supported).

subsection.name: Xpath expressions and XSLT
subsection.p: One of the latest features is the possibility to retrieve elements using xpath expressions and to apply on-the-fly XSLT transformations to retrieved elements.

subsection.name: Cache
subsection.p: In order to improve performance, the tool can be configured to use a cache (the underlying cache implementation is the open source library OsCache). Cached entries may be long-lived or short-lived depending on your needs and depending on the provider application.

subsection.name: User context
subsection.p: While calling the provider application, you may want to send informations about the currently connected user for personalization. The tool lets you transfer the user id, user locale and any key/value list. These informations will be automatically appended as request parameters to the http request.

subsection.name: Single Sign On with CAS
subsection.p: The kit supports CAS protocol using the proxy authentication mode and the JA-SIG CAS client.
